page.title: 14Transportation.
page.content: The railway which once linked the town of{Neath}with{Craig-y-Nos}in the Swansea Valley, carrying hundreds of men to and from their place of work in the many working collieries of the Dulais Valley, lost its passenger committment in the 1960s and is now used to transport{coal}down the valley from the washeries at Onllwyn. The main road artery through the Dulais Valley is the{A4109}although at the period of the Roman occupation the major link between south and mid-Wales,{Sarn Helen,}passed along the ridge to the east of the valley. From Crynant,the{A4109}may be followed to its joining with the{A465(T)}at Glyn-Neath, in the Vale of Neath. As an alternative there is a road link with the Swansea (Tawe) Valley across the Rhos Common to Ystradgynlais in the County of Powys.
